```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)
library(here)
```

```{r}
#Read in the data as an object 'ces' using here:
ces <- read.csv(here("data", "ces3demographics.csv")) %>% 
  
#Convert column headers to lower snake case:
janitor::clean_names()
```

```{r}
#Create a plot object to view the data
#Note that this looks REAAAALLLY weird....
percent_white_plot <- ces %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=white, y=ces_3_0_score))+
  geom_hex() + #Update graph type to 2D hexbin 
  labs(x = "White Population Percentage \n (Based on 2010 Census Data) ", y = "CalEnviroScreen Pollution Burden Score \n (CES 3.0 Score)") #label graph with appropriate axis labels
percent_white_plot
```
